Posts.Content: I'm very sorry to read this. I don't post much but I do read the posts. Please know that you're both in my thoughts and prayers.
Posts.Title: Hospice will be helping me now.

Posts.Content:
I'm scheduled for surgery on the 4th I was scheduled for the 14th but it was cancelled because of not being off my medications long enough and the doctor going on vacation. I just saw him yesterday and he said within 48 hrs it should be well on it's way to healing and I could shower and go swimming if I want. It's the guided wire that has to be done first that has me worried not the surgery itself. I expect to go back to work the next day. Other than that I'm as blind as you are with what to expect. Best of luck to you and try not to worry. 
Gail
Posts.Title: Calcification in Breast

Posts.Content: I'm just wondering if when you were at the doctors did you have them feel the area while in the position that you feel it in?  I'm just thinking that if you feel it standing up and they have you lie down to feel it they may not be finding it.
Posts.Title: lump can't be viewed on ultrasound or mammogram

Posts.Content:
Hi Tina, I see you answered my post on update of surgical biopsy so you see how far something can go and it still turns out to be nothing. When I had my first mammogram at your age (I'm 55)  a very small spot showed up, one to small to even biopsy. I was called back for more views and told to go back in 6 mos. Fourteen years later that spot is still there.  It's good to know your radiologist is on the ball and picked up something that might have gone unnoticed by another. With the new digital mammograms they pick up everything and that's a good thing. Please try to calm down and remember most things turn out to benign or disappear. I found out today that's very common.  Also, my DIL does mammograms and 20 might be done in one day with 3/4's turning out to be call backs. Out of all those 1 or 2 might  be problem. It all depends on whose reading your slides. She works with one radiologist whose so unsure of himself he calls back just about
 everyone so another radiologist can take a look. Please let us know how it turns out for you.
Posts.Title: hi please help if you can

Posts.Content: I am scheduled for a surgical biopsy on July 14th and don't know what to expect. Seems like everyone I know that has had a problem had the needle aspiration. I was told it would bleed to much so I have to have surgery.  Is there much pain afterword? Can you wear a bra or is there a certain kind/type I should wear? How many days off from work would I need? I was told I could go back the next day but I sure don't want to go back braless. I feel like I pulled the short end of the straw since I don't know anyone that has had this done so I don't know what to expect. On July 23rd my husband is having the seeds done for prostate cancer we found out he had last month. When it rains it pours around here. Thank you for your help ladies.
Posts.Title: Surgical Biopsy

Posts.Content:
Thank you Lauri,
My surgeon said he never misses, sure hope he's right 
 This has to be with a wire guide as there is no lump and it's close to the chest wall which is why they couldn't do a needle biopsy.
Posts.Title: Surgical Biopsy

Posts.Content: Thank you for your input ladies. The wire guided part before the surgery really has me on edge. I will let you know how it truns out.
Posts.Title: Surgical Biopsy

Posts.Content: Nervous? No way, you'll have great time nothing to be nervous over just relax and enjoy.  I would love to see Alaska let us know how you liked it. Gail
Posts.Title: Alaska bound
